subject: Relationships
title: Childhood Friends: The Longest Bonds
description: A fast breakdown of Childhood Friends: The Longest Bonds for builders.

hook.text: Your childhood best friend knows a version of you that no one else will ever meet.

buildup.text: Childhood friendships are formed during peak neuroplasticity. The brain literally builds itself around these bonds.

discovery.text: Adults who maintain at least one childhood friendship report higher life satisfaction across all measures.

twist.text: But most childhood friendships fade. Moving, growing apart, and diverging life paths dissolve 80% by adulthood.

climax.text: The childhood friends who survive do so because both people chose to stay â€” not because it was easy.

punchline.text: Childhood friends knew you before you performed. That's irreplaceable.

quiz.question: What percentage of childhood friendships fade by adulthood?
